options.description: left.fq file (or single.fq)
right.fq file (actually optional, but highly recommended)
Chimeric.out.junction file

directory containing genome lib (see http://STAR-Fusion.github.io)   (required to specify, unless env var CTAT_GENOME_LIB is set to it) Easiest - get plug-n-play version from: <https://data.broadinstitute.org/Trinity/CTAT_RESOURCE_LIB/>
number of threads for running STAR (default: 4)
output directory (default: STAR-Fusion_outdir)
provide full usage info.
maximum distance between mates (also used for the maximum intron length value) default: 100000
minimum overhang for annotated junctions default: 10
have STAR sort resulting bam file by coordinate
num GB of RAM, default: 40G
/path/to/STAR (default: uses STAR found in PATH setting).
stop after running STAR aligner (essentially just generating the Chimeric.out.junction file)
do STAR one pass instead of two pass (two pass is default)
minimum number of bases in the overlap (default: 12)
the max proportion of mismatches in the overlap (default: 0.1)
the score range for multi-mapping chimeras below the best chimeric score. (default: 3)
maximum number of multi-alignments for the chimera (default: 20)
to trigger chimeric detection, the drop in the best non-chimeric alignment score with respect to the read length has to be smaller than this value (default: 10)
pass through string value to STAR as --outSAMattrRGline for setting read group name info in bam. ie. --STAR_outSAMattrRGline "ID:myGRP"
min pct of multimapping reads that should map to 2 genes   (avoids multimapping reads that lack specificity) value must be between [1,100] (default: 50)
do not filter predictions. (stops execution prior to the filtering stage).
passed to STAR (very useful if local disks are faster than network disks),--min_junction_reads <int>   minimum number of junction-spanning reads required. Default: 1
minimum fusion support = ( # junction_reads + # spanning_frags ) Default: 2
require long double anchor support for split reads   when no spanning frags are found (default: 1)
maximum number of partners allowed for a given fusion. Default: 10
for promiscuous fusions, those with less than this support of the dominant scoring pair are filtered prior to applying the max_promiscuity filter. (default: 20)
default: 5 (non-ref junctions within 5 are merged into single calls)
default: 3  (minimum of 3   junction reads required if breakpoint lacks involvement of only reference junctions)
minimum number of rna-seq fragments required as fusion evidence if   there are no junction reads (default: 5)
default: 10  (10 % of the dominant isoform   junction support)
minimum FFPM (fusion fragments per million rna-seq frags) (default: 0.1)
do not remove duplicate reads
skips expectation maximization based fractional assignment of spanning fragments across multiple splice breakpoint fusion calls.

skip FFPM computation. FFPM is only computed correctly and meaningfully on per-sample analysis, or use of --samples_file where all entries in the samples file correspond to a single biological sample (ie. multiple lanes of seq, or replicates that are to be run as a single entity).
exclude filtering of fusion predictions based on annotations   (ie. by default, removing fusions found in normal (non-cancer) samples))

exclude filtering of likely RT artifacts   (by default, fusions w/o GT-AG, GC-AG, or AT-AC splice junctions at fusion breakpoint are excluded as likely artifacts, with few exceptions of known fusions that involve intra-exon breakpoints. ie. IGH-fusions)
exclude filtering of potentially superfluous fusions involving different gene annotations overlapping the same fusion breakpoint.
explore impact of fusions on coding sequences
retrieves the fusion supporting reads from the fastq files
'inspect' - considers only StarFusion-identified fusion reads in context of identified fusions (fast) 'validate' - examines all reads, recovers evidence, computes fusion allele fractions (slow)
attempt to reconstruct fusion transcripts using Trinity de novo assembly (requires --FusionInspector)
additional FI-specific options to pass on to FusionInspector
report version (1.11.0)

use shared memory among multiple processes for the STAR alignment step   # note, when this option is used, twopass mode is disabled, as it's incompatible w/ shared mem. ** (when all your jobs are done, be sure to run: 'STAR-Fusion --STAR_Remove' to unload it) **
runs STAR to load the genome index into shared RAM, then exits.
removes genome from shared RAM and exits.
file for temporary files (default: /tmp)
verbosity (default: 2, max=2)
includes options: --min_junction_reads 0 --min_sum_frags 1 --require_LDAS 0 --min_spanning_frags_only 1 --min_novel_junction_support 1 --skip_FFPM --no_single_fusion_per_breakpoint --skip_EM
includes max sensitivity and disables filters via: --max_promiscuity 1000000 --min_pct_dom_promiscuity 1 --min_alt_pct_junction 1e-3 --no_annotation_filter --no_RT_artifact_filter
